column3: Strongest possible Concept ACK -- will test :)\n\nBTW, I noticed that the fuzzing coverage link is broken on your otherwise excellent coverage statistics page. Will the merge of this fix that? :)

Which link is broken? https://marcofalke.github.io/btc_cov/ ?\n\nNote that the fuzzers were running into a stack overflow, thus unable to produce a result. So for a while that page was a 404. This should now be fixed with 657c5e5f1cd92169b5a3c880f01376b7ed0fd9b3
@MarcoFalke Ah, then the issue was temporary. Cannot reproduce today :)
> Strongest possible Concept ACK -- will test :)\n\n@practicalswift Are you still planning to test? :thinking:

@MarcoFalke Absolutely :)

I ran in to some problems - see below.

What versions of `gcov`, `lcov` and `clang++` are you using? I'm using `gcov` 7.5.0, `lcov` 1.13 and `clang++` 10.0.0.

```
$ make distclean
$ ./autogen.sh
$ ./configure --enable-fuzz --with-sanitizers=fuzzer --enable-lcov --enable-lcov-branch-coverage CC=clang CXX=clang++
$ make
$ git clone https://github.com
Other than that I use vanilla `debian:bullseye` with whatever clang comes in there.
@MarcoFalke Thanks! Works as expected with workaround applied.
